definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: When he is felicitous, he hears there's enormous roaring from the deep cliff.
sentences.chinese: 正在庆幸的时候，他听到断崖深处传来巨大的吼声。

sentences.english: The path verges on the edge of a precipice .
sentences.chinese: 这条小径濒临断崖的边缘。

sentences.english: Arriving at Manza, we take a walk to the cliffs and scenic spots.
sentences.chinese: 抵达万座海滩之后，我们将步行至断崖等景点。

sentences.english: We heard the groans of the man who had fallen off the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到那个跌入断崖者的呻吟声。

sentences.english: Both nuclear facilities are located above the water on coastal bluffs.
sentences.chinese: 两座核设施都位于加州沿海断崖上。

sentences.english: The true dips are commonly observed in quarry faces, cuttings and cliffs etc.
sentences.chinese: 在采场面，断面和断崖等面上人们常看到真倾角。

sentences.english: The shear cliff at Yosemite is an example of such rock breakage.
sentences.chinese: 优胜美地的断崖就是这样一种岩石碎裂的例子。

sentences.english: Mulan grabbed the rope, but Khan kept slipping toward the edge of a cliff.
sentences.chinese: 木兰抓住了绳索，但是汗马却向着断崖跑去。

sentences.english: That is a Japanese apricot, which has full of plums.
sentences.chinese: 那是长在断崖边的梅树，树上结满了梅子。

sentences.english: Two miles up, the crumbling precipices seem devoid of life.
sentences.chinese: 两哩高的地方，正在崩塌的断崖看似了无生气。

sentences.english: GROAN】We heard the groans of the man who had fallen off the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到那跌入断崖者的呻吟声。

definition: halfway up a mountain/lit. waist of mountain
sheer cliffs and precipitous rock faces (idiom)
sheer cliffs and precipitous rock faces (idiom)
